turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: It's true, isn't it?

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: Every word...

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: I know what it is to be ignored.

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: Tell us what you're going to make next, Walter.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: I'm gonna make the most wildest wittiest things you ever seen... gonna make big statues and li'l statues, tall statues n' short statues...

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: I mean, you look so pretty.

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: Thank you.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Are you ready?

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: Ready?  We've got plenty of time.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: I know.  But I wanted to talk to you.

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: Goodbye.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Bye!

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: Nice night out...

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Hm...

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: Well...what did you want to talk to me about?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Well...w-what kind of people do you like, Carla?

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: Oh, I don't know.  Smart people. Creative people I guess.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: You think I'm creative?

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: Of course I do!

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: That means you like me!

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: I like you very much, Walter.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: I thought you did on account of you kissed me the other night!

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: Well that was for your sculpture of the girl.  Your nude in the chair.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Carla -

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: - even though Leonard's always asking you to go out with him and I - just -

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: What are you trying to say?

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: Uh...  ...how long have you been thinking about this, Walter?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Oh...f-for a long time.  Ever since you first came to the club.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: But you gotta love me!  Why do you think I made that statue of Alice?!

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: Walter, I'm sorry...

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: You just can't be sorry! I wanna - I wanna marry you!

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: Now calm down Walter!  Now, let's go in there, and when the show's over, maybe we can talk about it.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: No! I want to talk about it now!

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: Walter...  I don't want to hurt your feelings but there is no way we're ever going to get...together.  You know what I mean?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Why not?!

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: Because...  We're just friends.  That's all. Just friends. WALTER I get it.  I see the whole thing now. No one knows if Walter Paisley is born!

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: Jeez, what is your problem all of a sudden?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Oh sure, let's string along poor Walter, see how far it will take us!

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: I'm sorry about what I said before.

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: Forget it.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: I've been thinking...  Carla, would you do one favor for me?

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: Just about anything, Walter.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Would you let me make...a statue of you?

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: Would you really like to?  That would make me very happy.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Ok...tonight.  I'll make a statue of you tonight, OK?

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: Walter...there's...

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: There's...a body inside that statue!

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: Walter...stay away from me!

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Don't you see Carla?  I made them immortal.

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: That's word for word.

turns.speaker: MAXWELL
turns.text: Is it?  I've forgotten.

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: Here you go, enjoy.

turns.speaker: MAXWELL
turns.text: I hope this was made with egg whites!

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: It was.

turns.speaker: MAXWELL
turns.text: What's this sauce!  I'm lactose intolerant.

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: Don't worry it's a non-dairy sauce made from soy milk.

turns.speaker: MAXWELL
turns.text: Hm.

turns.speaker: MAXWELL
turns.text: Put it in the middle of the room!

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: When did you make this, Walter?

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: Walter...I can't believe it.

turns.speaker: MAXWELL
turns.text: I'm honored to know this man.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Ah, your new head shot...  I like it, very much...

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: Do you have to be so cold to him?

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: I'm trying to find a style of my own.  Do you really like them?

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Oh yes...very nice...very, very nice...

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: Hi Walter...

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: What are you doing here so early?

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: Maybe so...

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: I wouldn't give up your day job.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: You've arrived.  You've been recognized.  You're a talent, a creative force to be reckoned with.

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: Leonard, what are you doing?

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: Are you trying to be funny?

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: I'm totally serious!

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Murdered...man?...

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: When do we get to see it? WALTER Well...any time, I guess.

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: Are you alright?

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Yes...I'm uh...I'm fine.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Yeah, I'm feeling a lot better.

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: Listen, I'm going over to Walter's after the place closes.  I want to get a look at Murdered Man.  Do you want to come along?

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: What's the matter with you?

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Nothing...nothing at all.

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: I've never seen anyone so... squeamish.  Well, what's your opinion, Leonard?

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Don't ask.

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: Oh come on!  Even you can see its value.

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: Well then admit it, it's a work of genius.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: I admit it.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: No.  Why don't you cover it up Walter...

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: Why not?

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Why don't you cover it up, Walter!

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: What's wrong with you, why do you want to hide it?

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Well, I've been thinking...  I didn't realize how much...talent Walter actually had.  It would be wrong for us to show them one at a time.  Dead wrong.

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: You're right.  We should build a collection first.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: It will take years to make that many statues.  But your work would be featured.

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: That's the idea, Walter.  It's the only way to gain recognition. All the big art critics and art dealers would be there, it would be an event.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Yeah then you could unload - sell this stuff for a lot more.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Carla and I will guide you, help develop and evolve your work...maybe lead you toward something more abstract...

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: Abstract?  With his talent for realism?

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: You see the direction his realism takes! It's unhealthy!

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Would you pose for me for free?

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: Well, it all depends, Leonard...

turns.speaker: CUFF
turns.text: It's our road kill series.  I take the pictures.

turns.speaker: LINK
turns.text: I do the research.

turns.speaker: LINK
turns.text: Yeah, can you say plagiarism?

turns.speaker: CUFF
turns.text: Not only that, he copied us!

turns.speaker: CUFF
turns.text: Look at that, man.  Big deal.

turns.speaker: LINK
turns.text: I know.

turns.speaker: CUFF
turns.text: I mean it's like, you know, I do my art because that's what I am, you know?  I'm an artist.  I'm not like a banker, you know.  Like I create.

turns.speaker: LINK
turns.text: I know, man.

turns.speaker: CUFF
turns.text: But it bugs me when someone rips off our ideas, our concepts, and people freak out about it, you know, and tell us ours stinks!

turns.speaker: LINK
turns.text: I know, man.

turns.speaker: CUFF
turns.text: I mean, screw them, you know?  I'm just gonna go right on creating 'cause it comes from here -  you know?

turns.speaker: LINK
turns.text: I know, man.

turns.speaker: LINK
turns.text: I wonder what his deal is.

turns.speaker: CUFF
turns.text: I think he's looking for you, man... it's all finally catching up with you!

turns.speaker: LINK
turns.text: Man that's a trippy name, kinda like the Warhol mayhem series...

turns.speaker: CUFF
turns.text: I saw a statue once called The Third Time Phyllis Saw Me She Exploded.

turns.speaker: LINK
turns.text: Now what kind of statue was that?

turns.speaker: CUFF
turns.text: I don't know it was made out of driftwood and dipped in sulfuric acid.  It was out there...

turns.speaker: CUFF
turns.text: There's that weird dude again.

turns.speaker: LINK
turns.text: Man if this place doesn't cool out I'm gonna hang out somewhere else...

turns.speaker: CUFF
turns.text: Man look at that get up !

turns.speaker: LINK
turns.text: Looks like that cat paid off in spades.

turns.speaker: CUFF
turns.text: Let's check out the scene.

turns.speaker: CUFF
turns.text: Man if you want to be a legit artist you have to do nudes, nudes, nudes...

turns.speaker: LINK
turns.text: Right.  Ain't no body of work complete without some... nudes -

turns.speaker: LINK
turns.text: Man this is heavy!

turns.speaker: CUFF
turns.text: Yeah what's this, Murdered Elephant?

turns.speaker: CUFF
turns.text: What did he say?

turns.speaker: LINK
turns.text: Didn't you hear him?

turns.speaker: CUFF
turns.text: No man I'm on my own plane.

turns.speaker: CUFF
turns.text: Man, why do you suppose Walter wants to get her alone?  You suppose he could be physically attracted to her?

turns.speaker: LINK
turns.text: No man, he ain't the type.  He don't get enough vitamin E.

turns.speaker: CUFF
turns.text: Maxwell gave him a bottle of wheat germ oil.  Maybe he started taking it.

turns.speaker: CUFF
turns.text: That's alright, we got a pressing engagement!

turns.speaker: LINK
turns.text: Yeah, right outside the door!

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Walter, what are you doing?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: I was just looking at Carla's picture.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Well that's not what I pay you for, now is it?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Well I was uh, just looking...

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Well do some looking around the room. I see cups, ashtrays - let's go...

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Well I brought something, I wanted to show you.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: What is it, your laundry?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Huh?

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Where'd ya buy that?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: I didn't buy it I made it.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: You...made that?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: I said I did, didn't I!

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Dead Cat!

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Dead Cat?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Well it sure looks dead enough.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: You want to buy it, put it in the club?

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: You want me to buy Dead Cat?  It'll scare people away.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Well...why did you put a knife in it?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: I didn't mean to.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Got carried away, huh?

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Alright, I'll tell you what.  I'll put it in the corner of the alcove. If it sells, we'll split it fifty- fifty.  How's that?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Sure!  So I guess that means I'm an artist after all.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: All that is comes through the eye of the artist...

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Alright get a grip on yourself Now since you're here why don't you start early, the kitchen needs cleaning.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Sure!

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: People seem to like my cat.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Enough already about it - get to work!

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Did you hear that Mr. De Santis? Everyone's really crazy about Dead Cat.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Yes they are, aren't they?  Look, why don't you take the rest of the night off, you look tired.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Well I don't know -

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: No, it's Ok...you came in early.  Besides, you're creating an incident. When people are applauding they don't order anything.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Well...

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Look, go home and...work on something. Make another cat.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: I don't have another cat!

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Well make a dog, make a parakeet! I'm sure you'll think of something.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: A parakeet?

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Go home.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: OK...good night Mr. De Santis!

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Good night Walter.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: H-have a seat?

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Have a seat -

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: I thought I'm not supposed to sit with the customers...

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Now why shouldn't you, Walter? Things are different now...

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: They are?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Hiya Carla.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: What am I doing?  I'm just telling Walter the truth.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: You know what that proves?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: What, Mr. De Santis?

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: The question is what are you going to make next, Walter?  Did you make that dog yet, or that parakeet?  How about making something out of the cockroaches in your room?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: I-I already got a new one!

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Well...why murdered man?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: I don't know, it just happened, I guess.  I didn't mean to.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: You didn't mean to what?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Well, I mean it could have been something else, but it just worked out that way.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: It's hot in here...

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: You want me to open a window or something?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: A show?!  Like this Sunday?

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: N-no!  Not exactly, I mean you take years and years...

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: A show..how soon can we go?

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: These things take time Walter... but for now you've got to break out of this one...avenue you're on...

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: You better hold off on the bubbly.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Yeah, why?

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: You might talk too much.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Yeah and what would I say?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Hello Leonard!  Beautiful morning, isn't it?

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: It was.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: What do you have in the box?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Just wait till you see this!

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Whatsamatter Leonard?

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: You made...a bust... WALTER  Yeah isn't it wonderful?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Whatsamatter Leonard?

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Put it down, Walter.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Walter...Walter listen carefully.  I don't want you to make any more statues.  Do you understand? No more statues.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Well Why not?  I gotta make statues Leonard.  You heard Maxwell, they want me to make them.  I can't go back to being a busboy!

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Maxwell!  He's behind all this with all his stupid blowhard poetry!  Listen, you've got to stop right away!  I'm beginning to feel responsible!

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Well, w-what did you do?

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Never mind...

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: When Carla comes by I'll talk to her.  She'll make up some nice invitations.  We'll have them printed up.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Well invite the critics, and the art collectors...we'll tell them...

turns.speaker: PLUMP MAN
turns.text: I tried to contact you by phone but I couldn't...

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Excuse me I have to make a call...

turns.speaker: PLUMP MAN
turns.text: I want that cat.  I'll pay you one thousand dollars - cash.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: I'm trying to reach Lieutenant Beldere...

turns.speaker: PLUMP MAN
turns.text: What offers have you got for it? I won't be out-bidded.  I'm a wealthy man and I don't mind paying for something I want.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: I can't talk right now.

turns.speaker: PLUMP MAN
turns.text: What do you want for it?  Two thousand? Three thousand?

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: No...look I'm busy...

turns.speaker: PLUMP MAN
turns.text: Listen to me...I don't want to lose this piece -

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: I'm holding for Lieutenant Beldere!

turns.speaker: PLUMP MAN
turns.text: Listen to me, listen to me...I've been collecting art pieces all over the world for years and let me tell you something.  This newcomer Walter Paisley has it, whatever it is, the X factor, that indefinable quality that separates the greats from the hacks, and I want that cat in my hands.  Are you listening to me?

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Can't you see I'm busy here?

turns.speaker: LOU
turns.text: How ya doin'?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Uh, hi.

turns.speaker: LOU
turns.text: Hello, Walter.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Hi.  I know you!  I've seen you down at the Jabberjaw plenty.

turns.speaker: LOU
turns.text: Yes, you have.  Can I come in?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Uh, sure.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: I was going to make some pancakes, you can have some if you like.

turns.speaker: LOU
turns.text: Hm.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Did you see my cat?

turns.speaker: LOU
turns.text: Yeah I did.

turns.speaker: LOU
turns.text: I also saw the girl give you this.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Oh yeah that was Mayolia, she's a nice girl.  She's kind of strange, though.

turns.speaker: LOU
turns.text: You like chasing the dragon, Walter?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Chasing the dragon?  Whaddya mean?  You sure you don't want a pancake?

turns.speaker: LOU
turns.text: You can cut the crap.

turns.speaker: LOU
turns.text: Police officer.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: You're like an undercover guy!

turns.speaker: LOU
turns.text: You're in some deep shit pal, whether you know it or not.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Huh?!!!

turns.speaker: LOU
turns.text: Possession of narcotics isn't something we take lightly, you understand?

turns.speaker: LOU
turns.text: But I got a feeling you're gonna cooperate with me.  Yessir, I think you and me are gonna be real good friends.  Why don't you tell me about your connection.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: C-connection?

turns.speaker: LOU
turns.text: I'm not looking to pinch you!  I don't care about you, or the girl.  But you want to save your ass, you better start telling me what I want to hear.  Now!

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Telling you what?

turns.speaker: LOU
turns.text: Who's the head honcho!  Who's providing the smack connection!

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Smack?

turns.speaker: LOU
turns.text: Goddammit, where are you from, Mars?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Alaska!  What the heck's wrong with it!

turns.speaker: LOU
turns.text: Haven't you ever heard of smack! Horse!  Junk!  Heroin!

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Is that what that is?  I never seen any before.  I always thought that stuff was expensive!

turns.speaker: LOU
turns.text: Oh, yeah.  It can get real expensive.

turns.speaker: LOU
turns.text: Who do think you're dealing with, huh?  I'm willing to cut you a break, chief!

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: You are?

turns.speaker: LOU
turns.text: Good ol' mild mannered Walter! Give it up.  It doesn't fly with me.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: I- don't know what you're talking about!

turns.speaker: LOU
turns.text: You're coming downtown with me, Walter.  You're gonna come clean with me, you're gonna name names or I swear to God I'll see to it personally you rot in a cell upstate! Are we understanding each other?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Wait a minute!  What'd I do?

turns.speaker: LOU
turns.text: I got you cold, pal.  Make it easy for yourself, use your head.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: I didn't do nothing wrong!  That was Mayolia's!  I didn't ask her for it.  I don't know about any -

turns.speaker: LOU
turns.text: Yeah yeah yeah - look!  I've heard this song and dance before, save your breath, you're coming with me! Lou goes to turn Walter against the wall but Walter springs back -

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Wait a minute - I told you I didn't do nothing wrong!

turns.speaker: LOU
turns.text: Don't give me a hard time Walter! You don't want to get me mad!  You're coming with me!

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: I ain't going no place with you!

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: You're gonna shoot me!

turns.speaker: LOU
turns.text: Turn around!

turns.speaker: LOU
turns.text: What are ya, deaf?  Turn around!

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: NO! NO DON'T SHOOT ME I DON'T WANT TO GET SHOT!

turns.speaker: LOU
turns.text: Relax!

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: YOU'RE GONNA SHOOT ME!

turns.speaker: LOU
turns.text: Walter shut up and relax!

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: NO YOU'RE GONNA SHOOT ME DON'T SHOOT -

turns.speaker: MAXWELL
turns.text: I don't think anyone gets what I said, their blank faces staring, mute, unfeeling -

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: I liked it very much Mr. Brock. I liked it very much.

turns.speaker: MAXWELL
turns.text: Well I'm overjoyed.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: "Let them die, and by their miserable death become the clay in his hands, that he might form an ashtray or an ark -"

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: I thought you believed that life is a homeless traveler riding on the RTD of -

turns.speaker: MAXWELL
turns.text: I know that - I know that! I also believe in burning the creative candle, you understand, down to the end - to be uncreative you might as well be dead...a walking machine, toiling in a factory!

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: I worked in one of them.  Back in Alaska.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Are you done with these?

turns.speaker: MAXWELL
turns.text: Yes, get rid of them...

turns.speaker: MAXWELL
turns.text: I saw your...cat.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Did you like it Mister Brock?

turns.speaker: MAXWELL
turns.text: Call me...Maxwell.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Maxwell.

turns.speaker: MAXWELL
turns.text: I see the rewards of achievement have come your way.

turns.speaker: MAXWELL
turns.text: And what project looms on the horizon, Walter?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Uh, I don't know.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Hi.

turns.speaker: MAXWELL
turns.text: Good morning Walter!

turns.speaker: MAXWELL
turns.text: Wheat germ omelette, guava nectar and garbanzo sprinkled with smoked yeast.  Join us?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: No thanks.  Sounds good though.

turns.speaker: MAXWELL
turns.text: Suit yourself.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: An' everyone will say Walter let me shake your hand...it's a real pleasure to have known you...

turns.speaker: MAXWELL
turns.text: Here here!
